meanings.definition: Karroos (noun): A type of arid, shrub-covered landscape found in South Africa.
meanings.sent1: The travelers marveled at the vast expanse of karroos stretching out before them.
meanings.sent2: The animals in the nature documentary roamed freely across the karroos.
meanings.sent3: The lost explorer stumbled upon a hidden oasis in the midst of the karroos.
meanings.sent4: The karroos whispered ancient stories to those who took the time to listen.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun painted the karroos in hues of gold and crimson, a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: Karroos (adjective): Describing something related to or characteristic of the Karroo region in South Africa.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the essence of the karroos landscape in his painting.
meanings.sent2: The traditional music festival celebrated the karroos culture with dance and song.
meanings.sent3: The quirky cafe in town had a karroos-themed decor, complete with cacti and sand.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, filling it with a karroos-like warmth.
meanings.sent5: The old book exuded a musty, karroos scent, reminiscent of dusty plains and wildflowers.
